verses.translation: And We shall make easy for you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) the easy way (i.e. the doing of righteous deeds).

verses.content: فَذَكِّرْ إِن نَّفَعَتِ الذِّكْرَىٰ
verses.translation: Therefore remind (men) in case the reminder profits (them).

verses.content: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰ
verses.translation: The reminder will be received by him who fears (Allah),

verses.content: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا الْأَشْقَى
verses.translation: But it will be avoided by the wretched,

verses.content: الَّذِي يَصْلَى النَّارَ الْكُبْرَىٰ
verses.translation: Who will enter the great Fire and made to taste its burning,

verses.content: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
verses.translation: Wherein he will neither die (to be in rest) nor live (a good living).

verses.content: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
verses.translation: Indeed whosoever purifies himself (by avoiding polytheism and accepting Islamic Monotheism) shall achieve success,

verses.content: وَذَكَرَ اسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلَّىٰ
verses.translation: And remembers (glorifies) the Name of his Lord (worships none but Allah), and prays (five compulsory prayers and Nawafil additional prayers).

verses.content: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
verses.translation: Nay, you prefer the life of this world;

verses.content: وَالْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.translation: Although the Hereafter is better and more lasting.

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَفِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ
verses.translation: Verily! This is in the former Scriptures,

verses.content: صُحُفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
verses.translation: The Scriptures of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Musa (Moses).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْغَاشِيَةِ
verses.translation: Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming (i.e. the Day of Resurrection);

verses.content: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَاشِعَةٌ
verses.translation: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated (in the Hell-fire, i.e. the faces of all disbelievers, Jews and Christians, etc.).

verses.content: عَامِلَةٌ نَّاصِبَةٌ
verses.translation: Labouring (hard in the worldly life by worshipping others besides Allah), weary (in the Hereafter with humility and disgrace).

verses.content: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً
verses.translation: They will enter in the hot blazing Fire,

verses.content: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ
verses.translation: They will be given to drink from a boiling spring,

verses.content: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
verses.translation: No food will there be for them but a poisonous thorny plant,

verses.content: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِن جُوعٍ
verses.translation: Which will neither nourish nor avail against hunger.

verses.content: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاعِمَةٌ
verses.translation: (Other) faces, that Day, will be joyful,

verses.content: لِّسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
verses.translation: Glad with their endeavour (for their good deeds which they did in this world, along with the true Faith of Islamic Monotheism).

verses.content: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
verses.translation: In a lofty Paradise.

verses.content: لَّا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَاغِيَةً
verses.translation: Where they shall neither hear harmful speech nor falsehood,

verses.content: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ
verses.translation: Therein will be a running spring,

verses.content: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَّرْفُوعَةٌ
verses.translation: Therein will be thrones raised high,

verses.content: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَّوْضُوعَةٌ
verses.translation: And cups set at hand.

verses.content: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ
verses.translation: And cushions set in rows,

verses.content: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ
verses.translation: And rich carpets (all) spread out.

verses.content: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى الْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
verses.translation: Do they not look at the camels, how they are created?

verses.content: وَإِلَى السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ
verses.translation: And at the heaven, how it is raised?

verses.content: وَإِلَى الْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ
verses.translation: And at the mountains, how they are rooted and fixed firm?

verses.content: وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ
verses.translation: And at the earth, how it is spread out?

verses.content: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
verses.translation: So remind them (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)), you are only a one who reminds.

verses.content: لَّسْتَ عَلَيْهِم بِمُصَيْطِرٍ
verses.translation: You are not a dictator over them.

verses.content: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
verses.translation: Save the one who turns away and disbelieves

verses.content: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ اللَّهُ الْعَذَابَ الْأَكْبَرَ
verses.translation: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.

verses.content: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَا إِيَابَهُمْ
verses.translation: Verily, to Us will be their return;

verses.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُم
verses.translation: Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْفَجْرِ
verses.translation: By the dawn;

verses.content: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ
verses.translation: By the ten nights (i.e. the first ten days of the month of Dhul-Hijjah).

verses.content: وَالشَّفْعِ وَالْوَتْرِ
verses.translation: And by the even and the odd (of all the creations of Allah).

verses.content: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
verses.translation: And by the night when it departs.

verses.content: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِي حِجْرٍ
verses.translation: There is indeed in them (the above oaths) sufficient proofs for men of understanding (and that, they should avoid all kinds of sins and disbeliefs, etc.)!

verses.content: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
verses.translation: Did you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) not see (thought) how your Lord dealt with 'Ad (people)?

verses.content: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ الْعِمَادِ
verses.translation: Who were very tall like lofty pillars,

verses.content: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ
verses.translation: The like of which were not created in the land?

verses.content: وَثَمُودَ الَّذِينَ جَابُوا الصَّخْرَ بِالْوَادِ
verses.translation: And (with) Thamud (people), who cut (hewed) out rocks in the valley (to make dwellings)?

verses.content: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِي الْأَوْتَادِ
verses.translation: And (with) Fir'aun (Pharaoh), who had pegs (who used to torture men by binding them to pegs)?

verses.content: الَّذِينَ طَغَوْا فِي الْبِلَادِ
verses.translation: Who did transgress beyond bounds in the lands (in the disobedience of Allah).

verses.content: فَأَكْثَرُوا فِيهَا الْفَسَادَ
verses.translation: And made therein much mischief.

verses.content: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ
verses.translation: So your Lord poured on them different kinds of severe torment.

verses.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِالْمِرْصَادِ
verses.translation: Verily, your Lord is Ever Watchful (over them).

verses.content: فَأَمَّا الْإِنسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ
verses.translation: As for man, when his Lord tries him by giving him honour and gifts, then he says (puffed up): "My Lord has honoured me."

verses.content: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ
verses.translation: But when He tries him, by straitening his means of life, he says: "My Lord has humiliated me!"

verses.content: كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا تُكْرِمُونَ الْيَتِيمَ
verses.translation: Nay! But you treat not the orphans with kindness and generosity (i.e. you neither treat them well, nor give them their exact right of inheritance)!

verses.content: وَلَا تَحَاضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
verses.translation: And urge not on the feeding of AlMiskin (the poor)!

verses.content: وَتَأْكُلُونَ التُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَّمًّا
verses.translation: And you devour inheritance all with greed,

verses.content: وَتُحِبُّونَ الْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا
verses.translation: And you love wealth with much love!

verses.content: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
verses.translation: Nay! When the earth is ground to powder,

verses.content: وَجَاءَ رَبُّكَ وَالْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا
verses.translation: And your Lord comes with the angels in rows,

verses.content: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
verses.translation: And Hell will be brought near that Day. On that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance (then) avail him?

verses.content: يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِي
verses.translation: He will say: "Alas! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my life!"

verses.content: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُ أَحَدٌ
verses.translation: So on that Day, none will punish as He will punish.

verses.content: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُ أَحَدٌ
verses.translation: And none will bind as He will bind.

verses.content: يَا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفْسُ الْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ
verses.translation: (It will be said to the pious): "O (you) the one in (complete) rest and satisfaction!

verses.content: ارْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَّرْضِيَّةً
verses.translation: "Come back to your Lord, Well-pleased (yourself) and well-pleasing unto Him!

verses.content: فَادْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي
verses.translation: "Enter you, then, among My honoured slaves,

verses.content: وَادْخُلِي جَنَّتِي
verses.translation: "And enter you My Paradise!"

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
verses.translation: I swear by this city (Makkah);

verses.content: وَأَنتَ حِلٌّ بِهَـٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
verses.translation: And you are free (from sin, to punish the enemies of Islam on the Day of the conquest) in this city (Makkah).

verses.content: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
verses.translation: And by the begetter (i.e. Adam) and that which he begot (i.e. his progeny);

verses.content: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ فِي كَبَدٍ
verses.translation: Verily, We have created man in toil.

verses.content: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
verses.translation: Thinks he that none can overcome him?

verses.content: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُّبَدًا
verses.translation: He says (boastfully): "I have wasted wealth in abundance!"

verses.content: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّمْ يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ
verses.translation: Thinks he that none sees him?

verses.content: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُ عَيْنَيْنِ
verses.translation: Have We not made for him a pair of eyes?

verses.content: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
verses.translation: And a tongue and a pair of lips?

verses.content: وَهَدَيْنَاهُ النَّجْدَيْنِ
verses.translation: And shown him the two ways (good and evil)?

verses.content: فَلَا اقْتَحَمَ الْعَقَبَةَ
verses.translation: But he has made no effort to pass on the path that is steep.

verses.content: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْعَقَبَةُ
verses.translation: And what will make you know the path that is steep?

verses.content: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
verses.translation: (It is) Freeing a neck (slave, etc.)

verses.content: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ
verses.translation: Or giving food in a day of hunger (famine),

verses.content: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ
verses.translation: To an orphan near of kin.

verses.content: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ
verses.translation: Or to a Miskin (poor) afflicted with misery.

verses.content: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ
verses.translation: Then he became one of those who believed, and recommended one another to perseverance and patience, and (also) recommended one another to pity and compassion.

verses.content: أُولَـٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ
verses.translation: They are those on the Right Hand (the dwellers of Paradise),

verses.content: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
verses.translation: But those who disbelieved in Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), they are those on the Left Hand (the dwellers of Hell).

verses.content: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُّؤْصَدَةٌ
verses.translation: The Fire will be shut over them (i.e. they will be enveloped by the Fire without any opening or window or outlet.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا
verses.translation: And by the sun and its brightness;

verses.content: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَاهَا
verses.translation: And by the moon as it follows it (the sun);

verses.content: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّاهَا
verses.translation: And by the day as it shows up (the sun's) brightness;

verses.content: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَاهَا
verses.translation: And by the night as it conceals it (the sun);

verses.content: وَالسَّمَاءِ وَمَا بَنَاهَا
verses.translation: And by the heaven and Him Who built it;

verses.content: وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَاهَا
verses.translation: And by the earth and Him Who spread it,

verses.content: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّاهَا
verses.translation: And by Nafs (Adam or a person or a soul, etc.), and Him Who perfected him in proportion;

verses.content: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَاهَا
verses.translation: Then He showed him what is wrong for him and what is right for him;

verses.content: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن زَكَّاهَا
verses.translation: Indeed he succeeds who purifies his ownself (i.e. obeys and performs all that Allah ordered, by following the true Faith of Islamic Monotheism and by doing righteous good deeds).

verses.content: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَن دَسَّاهَا
verses.translation: And indeed he fails who corrupts his ownself (i.e. disobeys what Allah has ordered by rejecting the true Faith of Islamic Monotheism or by following polytheism, etc. or by doing every kind of evil wicked deeds).

verses.content: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَاهَا
verses.translation: Thamud (people) denied (their Prophet) through their transgression (by rejecting the true Faith of Islamic Monotheism, and by following polytheism, and by committing every kind of sin).

verses.content: إِذِ انبَعَثَ أَشْقَاهَا
verses.translation: When the most wicked man among them went forth (to kill the she-camel).

verses.content: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ نَاقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقْيَاهَا
verses.translation: But the Messenger of Allah [Salih (Saleh)] said to them: "Be cautious! Fear the evil end. That is the she-camel of Allah! (Do not harm it) and bar it not from having its drink!"

verses.content: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِذَنبِهِمْ فَسَوَّاهَا
verses.translation: Then they denied him and they killed it. So their Lord destroyed them because of their sin, and made them equal in destruction (i.e. all grades of people, rich and poor, strong and weak, etc.)!

verses.content: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَاهَا
verses.translation: And He (Allah) feared not the consequences thereof.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
verses.translation: By the night as it envelops;

verses.content: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
verses.translation: And by the day as it appears in brightness;

verses.content: وَمَا خَلَقَ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنثَىٰ
verses.translation: And by Him Who created male and female;

verses.content: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ
verses.translation: Certainly, your efforts and deeds are diverse (different in aims and purposes);

verses.content: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَاتَّقَىٰ
verses.translation: As for him who gives (in charity) and keeps his duty to Allah and fears Him,

verses.content: وَصَدَّقَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.translation: And believes in Al-Husna.

verses.content: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
verses.translation: We will make smooth for him the path of ease (goodness).

verses.content: وَأَمَّا مَن بَخِلَ وَاسْتَغْنَىٰ
verses.translation: But he who is greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient.

verses.content: وَكَذَّبَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.translation: And gives the lie to Al-Husna (see Verse No: 6 footnote);

verses.content: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ
verses.translation: We will make smooth for him the path for evil;

verses.content: وَمَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُ مَالُهُ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰ
verses.translation: And what will his wealth benefit him when he goes down (in destruction).

verses.content: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ
verses.translation: Truly! Ours it is (to give) guidance,

verses.content: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْآخِرَةَ وَالْأُولَىٰ
verses.translation: And truly, unto Us (belong) the last (Hereafter) and the first (this world).

verses.content: فَأَنذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ
verses.translation: Therefore I have warned you of a Fire blazing fiercely (Hell);

verses.content: لَا يَصْلَاهَا إِلَّا الْأَشْقَى
verses.translation: None shall enter it save the most wretched,

verses.content: الَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
verses.translation: Who denies and turns away.

verses.content: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا الْأَتْقَى
verses.translation: And Al-Muttaqun (the pious and righteous - see V. 2:2) will be far removed from it (Hell).

verses.content: الَّذِي يُؤْتِي مَالَهُ يَتَزَكَّىٰ
verses.translation: He who spends his wealth for increase in self-purification,

verses.content: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُ مِن نِّعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰ
verses.translation: And have in his mind no favour from anyone for which a reward is expected in return,

verses.content: إِلَّا ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ الْأَعْلَىٰ
verses.translation: Except only the desire to seek the Countenance of his Lord, the Most High;

verses.content: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ
verses.translation: He surely will be pleased (when he will enter Paradise).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالضُّحَىٰ
verses.translation: By the forenoon (after sun-rise);

verses.content: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
verses.translation: And by the night when it is still (or darkens);

verses.content: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
verses.translation: Your Lord (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) has neither forsaken you nor hated you.

verses.content: وَلَلْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَّكَ مِنَ الْأُولَىٰ
verses.translation: And indeed the Hereafter is better for you than the present (life of this world).

verses.content: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ
verses.translation: And verily, your Lord will give you (all i.e. good) so that you shall be well-pleased.

verses.content: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَآوَىٰ
verses.translation: Did He not find you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) an orphan and gave you a refuge?

verses.content: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَالًّا فَهَدَىٰ
verses.translation: And He found you unaware (of the Quran, its legal laws, and Prophethood, etc.) and guided you?

verses.content: وَوَجَدَكَ عَائِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
verses.translation: And He found you poor, and made you rich (selfsufficient with selfcontentment, etc.)?

verses.content: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ
verses.translation: Therefore, treat not the orphan with oppression,

verses.content: وَأَمَّا السَّائِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ
verses.translation: And repulse not the beggar;

verses.content: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ
verses.translation: And proclaim the Grace of your Lord (i.e. the Prophethood and all other Graces).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
verses.translation: Have We not opened your breast for you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him))?

verses.content: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنكَ وِزْرَكَ
verses.translation: And removed from you your burden,

verses.content: الَّذِي أَنقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ
verses.translation: Which weighed down your back?

verses.content: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
verses.translation: And raised high your fame?

verses.content: فَإِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
verses.translation: So verily, with the hardship, there is relief,

verses.content: إِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
verses.translation: Verily, with the hardship, there is relief (i.e. there is one hardship with two reliefs, so one hardship cannot overcome two reliefs).

verses.content: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَانصَبْ
verses.translation: So when you have finished (from your occupation), then stand up for Allah's worship (i.e. stand up for prayer).

verses.content: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَارْغَب
verses.translation: And to your Lord (Alone) turn (all your intentions and hopes and) your invocations.

verses.content: بِّسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ
verses.translation: By the fig, and the olive,

verses.content: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
verses.translation: By Mount Sinai,

verses.content: وَهَـٰذَا الْبَلَدِ الْأَمِينِ
verses.translation: And by this city of security (Makkah).

verses.content: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ فِي أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
verses.translation: Verily, We created man of the best stature (mould),

verses.content: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَاهُ أَسْفَلَ سَافِلِينَ
verses.translation: Then We reduced him to the lowest of the low,

verses.content: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
verses.translation: Save those who believe (in Islamic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds, then they shall have a reward without end (Paradise).

verses.content: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ
verses.translation: Then what (or who) causes you (O disbelievers) to deny the Recompense (i.e. Day of Resurrection)?

verses.content: أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ الْحَاكِمِينَ
verses.translation: Is not Allah the Best of judges?

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْرَأْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ
verses.translation: Read! In the Name of your Lord, Who has created (all that exists),

verses.content: خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ
verses.translation: Has created man from a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood).

verses.content: اقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ الْأَكْرَمُ
verses.translation: Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous,

verses.content: الَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِالْقَلَمِ
verses.translation: Who has taught (the writing) by the pen [the first person to write was Prophet Idrees (Enoch)].

verses.content: عَلَّمَ الْإِنسَانَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
verses.translation: Has taught man that which he knew not.

verses.content: كَلَّا إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لَيَطْغَىٰ
verses.translation: Nay! Verily, man does transgress all bounds (in disbelief and evil deed, etc.).

verses.content: أَن رَّآهُ اسْتَغْنَىٰ
verses.translation: Because he considers himself self-sufficient.

verses.content: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الرُّجْعَىٰ
verses.translation: Surely! Unto your Lord is the return.

verses.content: أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يَنْهَىٰ
verses.translation: Have you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) seen him (i.e. Abu Jahl) who prevents,

verses.content: عَبْدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰ
verses.translation: A slave (Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) when he prays?

verses.content: أَرَأَيْتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى الْهُدَىٰ
verses.translation: Tell me, if he (Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) is on the guidance (of Allah)?

verses.content: أَوْ أَمَرَ بِالتَّقْوَىٰ
verses.translation: Or enjoins piety?

verses.content: أَرَأَيْتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
verses.translation: Tell me if he (the disbeliever, Abu Jahl) denies (the truth, i.e. this Quran), and turns away?

verses.content: أَلَمْ يَعْلَم بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَرَىٰ
verses.translation: Knows he not that Allah does see (what he does)?

verses.content: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ
verses.translation: Nay! If he (Abu Jahl) ceases not, We will catch him by the forelock,

verses.content: نَاصِيَةٍ كَاذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٍ
verses.translation: A lying, sinful forelock!

verses.content: فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُ
verses.translation: Then, let him call upon his council (of helpers),

verses.content: سَنَدْعُ الزَّبَانِيَةَ
verses.translation: We will call the guards of Hell (to deal with him)!

verses.content: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعْهُ وَاسْجُدْ وَاقْتَرِب ۩
verses.translation: Nay! (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him))! Do not obey him (Abu Jahl). Fall prostrate and draw near to Allah!

verses.content: بِّسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ
verses.translation: Verily! We have sent it (this Quran) down in the night of Al-Qadr (Decree)

verses.content: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ
verses.translation: And what will make you know what the night of Al-Qadr (Decree) is?

verses.content: لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
verses.translation: The night of Al-Qadr (Decree) is better than a thousand months (i.e. worshipping Allah in that night is better than worshipping Him a thousand months, (i.e. 83 years and 4 months).

verses.content: تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
verses.translation: Therein descend the angels and the Ruh [Jibrael (Gabriel)] by Allah's Permission with all Decrees,

verses.content: سَلَامٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ الْفَجْرِ
verses.translation: Peace! (All that night, there is Peace and Goodness from Allah to His believing slaves) until the appearance of dawn.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
verses.translation: Those who disbelieve from among the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and among Al-Mushrikun, were not going to leave (their disbelief) until there came to them clear evidence.

verses.content: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ اللَّهِ يَتْلُو صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً
verses.translation: A Messenger (Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) from Allah, reciting (the Quran) purified pages [purified from Al-Batil (falsehood, etc.)].

verses.content: فِيهَا كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ
verses.translation: Containing correct and straight laws from Allah.

verses.content: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
verses.translation: And the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) differed not until after there came to them clear evidence. (i.e. Prophet Muhammad (Peace be upon him) and whatever was revealed to him).

verses.content: وَمَا أُمِرُوا إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ حُنَفَاءَ وَيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ الْقَيِّمَةِ
verses.translation: And they were commanded not, but that they should worship Allah, and worship none but Him Alone (abstaining from ascribing partners to Him), and perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat) and give Zakat: and that is the right religion.

verses.content: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ الْبَرِيَّةِ
verses.translation: Verily, those who disbelieve (in the religion of Islam, the Quran and Prophet Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) from among the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and Al-Mushrikun will abide in the Fire of Hell. They are the worst of creatures.

verses.content: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ الْبَرِيَّةِ
verses.translation: Verily, those who believe [in the Oneness of Allah, and in His Messenger Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) including all obligations ordered by Islam] and do righteous good deeds, they are the best of creatures.

verses.content: جَزَاؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ رَّضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ
verses.translation: Their reward with their Lord is 'Adn (Eden) Paradise (Gardens of Eternity), underneath which rivers flow, they will abide therein forever, Allah Well-Pleased with them, and they with Him. That is for him who fears his Lord.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا
verses.translation: When the earth is shaken with its (final) earthquake.

verses.content: وَأَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا
verses.translation: And when the earth throws out its burdens,

verses.content: وَقَالَ الْإِنسَانُ مَا لَهَا
verses.translation: And man will say: "What is the matter with it?"

verses.content: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا
verses.translation: That Day it will declare its information (about all what happened over it of good or evil).

verses.content: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوْحَىٰ لَهَا
verses.translation: Because your Lord has inspired it.

verses.content: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ
verses.translation: That Day mankind will proceed in scattered groups that they may be shown their deeds.

verses.content: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ
verses.translation: So whosoever does good equal to the weight of an atom (or a small ant), shall see it.

verses.content: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
verses.translation: And whosoever does evil equal to the weight of an atom (or a small ant), shall see it.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا
verses.translation: By the (steeds) that run, with panting (breath),

verses.content: فَالْمُورِيَاتِ قَدْحًا
verses.translation: Striking sparks of fire (by their hooves),

verses.content: فَالْمُغِيرَاتِ صُبْحًا
verses.translation: And scouring to the raid at dawn

verses.content: فَأَثَرْنَ بِهِ نَقْعًا
verses.translation: And raise the dust in clouds the while,

verses.content: فَوَسَطْنَ بِهِ جَمْعًا
verses.translation: Penetrating forthwith as one into the midst (of the foe);

verses.content: إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لِرَبِّهِ لَكَنُودٌ
verses.translation: Verily! Man (disbeliever) is ungrateful to his Lord;

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٌ
verses.translation: And to that fact he bears witness (by his deeds);

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُ لِحُبِّ الْخَيْرِ لَشَدِيدٌ
verses.translation: And verily, he is violent in the love of wealth.

verses.content: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ
verses.translation: Knows he not that when the contents of the graves are brought out and poured forth (all mankind is resurrected).

verses.content: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي الصُّدُورِ
verses.translation: And that which is in the breasts (of men) shall be made known.

verses.content: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّخَبِيرٌ
verses.translation: Verily, that Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) their Lord will be Well-Acquainted with them (as to their deeds), (and will reward them for their deeds).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْقَارِعَةُ
verses.translation: Al-Qari'ah (the striking Hour i.e. the Day of Resurrection),

verses.content: مَا الْقَارِعَةُ
verses.translation: What is the striking (Hour)?

verses.content: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْقَارِعَةُ
verses.translation: And what will make you know what the striking (Hour) is?

verses.content: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ النَّاسُ كَالْفَرَاشِ الْمَبْثُوثِ
verses.translation: It is a Day whereon mankind will be like moths scattered about,

verses.content: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ الْمَنفُوشِ
verses.translation: And the mountains will be like carded wool,

verses.content: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ
verses.translation: Then as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be heavy,

verses.content: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
verses.translation: He will live a pleasant life (in Paradise).

verses.content: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ
verses.translation: But as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be light,

verses.content: فَأُمُّهُ هَاوِيَةٌ
verses.translation: He will have his home in Hawiyah (pit, i.e. Hell).

verses.content: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا هِيَهْ
verses.translation: And what will make you know what it is?

verses.content: نَارٌ حَامِيَةٌ
verses.translation: (It is) a hot blazing Fire!

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلْهَاكُمُ التَّكَاثُرُ
verses.translation: The mutual rivalry for piling up of worldly things diverts you,

verses.content: حَتَّىٰ زُرْتُمُ الْمَقَابِرَ
verses.translation: Until you visit the graves (i.e. till you die).

verses.content: كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Nay! You shall come to know!

verses.content: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Again, Nay! You shall come to know!

verses.content: كَلَّا لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ الْيَقِينِ
verses.translation: Nay! If you knew with a sure knowledge (the end result of piling up, you would not have occupied yourselves in worldly things)

verses.content: لَتَرَوُنَّ الْجَحِيمَ
verses.translation: Verily, You shall see the blazing Fire (Hell)!

verses.content: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيْنَ الْيَقِينِ
verses.translation: And again, you shall see it with certainty of sight!

verses.content: ثُمَّ لَتُسْأَلُنَّ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَنِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.translation: Then, on that Day, you shall be asked about the delight (you indulged in, in this world)!

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَصْرِ
verses.translation: By Al-'Asr (the time).

verses.content: إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لَفِي خُسْرٍ
verses.translation: Verily! Man is in loss,

verses.content: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ
verses.translation: Except those who believe (in Islamic Monotheism) and do righteous good deeds, and recommend one another to the truth (i.e. order one another to perform all kinds of good deeds (Al-Ma'ruf) which Allah has ordained, and abstain from all kinds of sins and evil deeds (Al-Munkar) which Allah has forbidden), and recommend one another to patience (for the sufferings, harms, and injuries which one may encounter in Allah's Cause during preaching His religion of Islamic Monotheism or Jihad, etc.).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُّمَزَةٍ
verses.translation: Woe to every slanderer and backbiter.

verses.content: الَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالًا وَعَدَّدَهُ
verses.translation: Who has gathered wealth and counted it,

verses.content: يَحْسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُ أَخْلَدَهُ
verses.translation: He thinks that his wealth will make him last forever!

verses.content: كَلَّا ۖ لَيُنبَذَنَّ فِي الْحُطَمَةِ
verses.translation: Nay! Verily, he will be thrown into the crushing Fire.

verses.content: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحُطَمَةُ
verses.translation: And what will make you know what the crushing Fire is?

verses.content: نَارُ اللَّهِ الْمُوقَدَةُ
verses.translation: The fire of Allah, kindled,

verses.content: الَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى الْأَفْئِدَةِ
verses.translation: Which leaps up over the hearts,

verses.content: إِنَّهَا عَلَيْهِم مُّؤْصَدَةٌ
verses.translation: Verily, it shall be closed in on them,

verses.content: فِي عَمَدٍ مُّمَدَّدَةٍ
verses.translation: In pillars stretched forth (i.e. they will be punished in the Fire with pillars, etc.).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ
verses.translation: Have you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) not seen how your Lord dealt with the Owners of the Elephant? [The elephant army which came from Yemen under the command of Abrahah Al-Ashram intending to destroy the Ka'bah at Makkah].

verses.content: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِي تَضْلِيلٍ
verses.translation: Did He not make their plot go astray?

verses.content: وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْرًا أَبَابِيلَ
verses.translation: And sent against them birds, in flocks,

verses.content: تَرْمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٍ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
verses.translation: Striking them with stones of Sijjil.

verses.content: فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَّأْكُولٍ
verses.translation: And made them like an empty field of stalks (of which the corn has been eaten up by cattle).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لِإِيلَافِ قُرَيْشٍ
verses.translation: (It is a great Grace and Protection from Allah), for the taming of the Quraish,

verses.content: إِيلَافِهِمْ رِحْلَةَ الشِّتَاءِ وَالصَّيْفِ
verses.translation: (And with all those Allah's Grace and Protections for their taming, We cause) the (Quraish) caravans to set forth safe in winter (to the south), and in summer (to the north without any fear),

verses.content: فَلْيَعْبُدُوا رَبَّ هَـٰذَا الْبَيْتِ
verses.translation: So let them worship (Allah) the Lord of this House (the Ka'bah in Makkah).

verses.content: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍ
verses.translation: (He) Who has fed them against hunger, and has made them safe from fear.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِالدِّينِ
verses.translation: Have you seen him who denies the Recompense?

verses.content: فَذَٰلِكَ الَّذِي يَدُعُّ الْيَتِيمَ
verses.translation: That is he who repulses the orphan (harshly),

verses.content: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
verses.translation: And urges not the feeding of AlMiskin (the poor),

verses.content: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْمُصَلِّينَ
verses.translation: So woe unto those performers of Salat (prayers) (hypocrites),

verses.content: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَن صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ
verses.translation: Who delay their Salat (prayer) from their stated fixed times,

verses.content: الَّذِينَ هُمْ يُرَاءُونَ
verses.translation: Those who do good deeds only to be seen (of men),

verses.content: وَيَمْنَعُونَ الْمَاعُونَ
verses.translation: And refuse Al-Ma'un (small kindnesses e.g. salt, sugar, water, etc.).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَعْطَيْنَاكَ الْكَوْثَرَ
verses.translation: Verily, We have granted you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) Al-Kauthar (a river in Paradise);

verses.content: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَانْحَرْ
verses.translation: Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice (to Him only).

verses.content: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ الْأَبْتَرُ
verses.translation: For he who makes you angry (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)), - he will be cut off (from every good thing in this world and in the Hereafter).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.translation: Say (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him) to these Mushrikun and Kafirun): "O Al-Kafirun (disbelievers in Allah, in His Oneness, in His Angels, in His Books, in His Messengers, in the Day of Resurrection, and in Al-Qadar, etc.)!

verses.content: لَا أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: "I worship not that which you worship,

verses.content: وَلَا أَنتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ
verses.translation: "Nor will you worship that which I worship.

verses.content: وَلَا أَنَا عَابِدٌ مَّا عَبَدتُّمْ
verses.translation: "And I shall not worship that which you are worshipping.

verses.content: وَلَا أَنتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ
verses.translation: "Nor will you worship that which I worship.

verses.content: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِيَ دِينِ
verses.translation: "To you be your religion, and to me my religion (Islamic Monotheism)."

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا جَاءَ نَصْرُ اللَّهِ وَالْفَتْحُ
verses.translation: When comes the Help of Allah (to you, O Muhammad (Peace be upon him) against your enemies) and the conquest (of Makkah),

verses.content: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
verses.translation: And you see that the people enter Allah's religion (Islam) in crowds,

verses.content: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
verses.translation: So glorify the Praises of your Lord, and ask for His Forgiveness. Verily, He is the One Who accepts the repentance and forgives.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَا أَبِي لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
verses.translation: Perish the two hands of Abu Lahab (an uncle of the Prophet), and perish he!

verses.content: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
verses.translation: His wealth and his children (etc.) will not benefit him!

verses.content: سَيَصْلَىٰ نَارًا ذَاتَ لَهَبٍ
verses.translation: He will be burnt in a Fire of blazing flames!

verses.content: وَامْرَأَتُهُ حَمَّالَةَ الْحَطَبِ
verses.translation: And his wife too, who carries wood (thorns of Sadan which she used to put on the way of the Prophet (Peace be upon him), or use to slander him).

verses.content: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبْلٌ مِّن مَّسَدٍ
verses.translation: In her neck is a twisted rope of Masad (palm fibre).

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
verses.translation: Say (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)): "He is Allah, (the) One.

verses.content: اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ
verses.translation: "Allah-us-Samad (The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He neither eats nor drinks).

verses.content: لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ
verses.translation: "He begets not, nor was He begotten;

verses.content: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
verses.translation: "And there is none co-equal or comparable unto Him."

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ
verses.translation: Say: "I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak,

verses.content: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
verses.translation: "From the evil of what He has created;

verses.content: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ
verses.translation: "And from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness; (or the moon as it sets or goes away).

verses.content: وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ
verses.translation: "And from the evil of the witchcrafts when they blow in the knots,

verses.content: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
verses.translation: "And from the evil of the envier when he envies."

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ
verses.translation: Say: "I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind,

verses.content: مَلِكِ النَّاسِ
verses.translation: "The King of mankind,

verses.content: إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ
verses.translation: "The Ilah (God) of mankind,

verses.content: مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ
verses.translation: "From the evil of the whisperer (devil who whispers evil in the hearts of men) who withdraws (from his whispering in one's heart after one remembers Allah),

verses.content: الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ
verses.translation: "Who whispers in the breasts of mankind,

verses.content: مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
verses.translation: "Of jinns and men."
